sentence.Network_en: Your foolish talk makes me cringe.
He abandoned every particle of self - respect cringe and fawn.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把 自尊心 丢得一干二净.

sentence.Network_en: His way of sleeping makes me cringe.
sentence.Network_cn: 他睡觉的方式令我生厌.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English crenge, crenche, related to Old English cringan, crincan 'bend, yield, fall in battle', of Germanic origin and related to Dutch krengen 'heel over' and German krank 'sick', also to crank

entry.tran: 为…觉得难为情;对…感到厌恶；退缩
entry.def: If you cringe at something, you feel embarrassed or disgusted, and perhaps show this feeling in your expression or by making a slight movement.

example.ex: Molly had cringed when Ann started picking up the guitar...
example.tran: 安开始弹吉他时，莫莉感到有些难堪。

example.ex: Chris had cringed at the thought of using her own family for publicity...
example.tran: 一想到要拿自己的家庭作宣传，克丽丝就感到厌烦。

means.word_mean: 1. draw back, as with fear or pain;

sentences.sentence: "she flinched when they showed the slaughtering of the calf"

auth_sentence.content: Investors are left wondering whether to cheer or cringe.

sentences.en: The dog cringed when it saw my stick.
sentences.cn: 狗看见我的手杖就退缩了。
